headline: Iran in collective shock after bloody crackdown
subhead: Even though internet access remains mostly cut off, a few openings have allowed the population to grasp the unprecedented violence unleashed on protesters: tens of thousands killed, mass arrests, hospitals under surveillance and overcrowded prisons.

headline: Trump says will 'de-escalate' in Minneapolis after shooting backlash

Judge temporarily blocks deportation of five-year-old  detained by ICE
subhead: Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, Adrian Conejo Arias, who are asylum seekers from Ecuador, were arrested on January 20 by ICE agents. The superintendent of Columbia Heights Public Schools, where Ramos was a preschool student, said the pair was taken from their driveway as they arrived home.

headline: French Parliament aims to abolish 'marital duty,' an outdated concept
subhead: A cross-party bill seeks to amend articles of the French Civil Code to challenge the notion that married couples are required to have regular sexual relations. The legislation is primarily educational, intended to bring the issue of marital rape into public debate.

headline: Paris's Musée Marmottan Monet explores the mysterious state of sleep
subhead: Thanks to exceptional loans, an innovative and thought-provoking exhibition at the museum explores how slumber has inspired painters.

headline: Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhead: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.

headline: Footage shows death of Alex Pretti, killed by US Border Patrol in Minneapolis
subhead: The 37-year-old nurse was killed Saturday after federal immigration agents fired at least 10 shots.

headline: Eiffel Tower to honor 72 women scientists for posterity
subhead: On Monday, a multidisciplinary commission presented the mayor of Paris with a list of 72 names of women who will join the exclusively male scientists whose names are inscribed on the frieze of the 'Iron Lady.'
